intro: Antirrhinum saphyrinum var. incarnatum, commonly known as the Crimson Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
